Biography

About Williams: A talented guard, Williams rejoins the Bears for his senior campaign after a breakout sophomore and junior seasons that saw him become one of the top guards in the CACC and score his 1,000th career point. Bloomfield will look to Williams to continue his role as one of the top perimeter players in the East Region, and be one of the primary offensive weapons for the club in the 2014-2015 season.

As a freshman: Played in 31 games with 25 starts, averaging 27.9 minutes per contest...Finished third on the team in scoring, averaging 11.2 points per game during his rookie campaign...Posted averages of 3.9 rebounds and 1.8 assists per contest...Shot just over 41% from the field as a freshman in 2011-2012..Led the team and finished fourth in the CACC in free-throw percentage, converting 84% of his attempts from the charity stripe (good for 50th in the nation)...Placed 30th in the CACC in points per game...Reached double-figures in scoring in 18 games, surpassing 20 points three times (twice in postseason play)...Went for 25 points and hit the game-winning bucket at the buzzer to defeat CACC South Division rival Holy Family University in the opening round of the CACC Tournament, helping the freshman earn a selection to the All-Tournament Team...Totaled a career-high 28 points in the NCAA Tournament East Regional Final against Stonehill, earning the rookie a East Regional All-Tournament Team selection.

Before Bloomfield: A standout at Marist High School, Williams was a two-time Hudson County Player of the Year honoree during his outstanding high school career, and recorded a 41-point, eight three-pointer game during his tenure at Marist.

Why Marvin chose Division II: "I chose to come to Bloomfield because when I visited the campus, I felt immediately at home. It was an easy decision for me."
